org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry

Class RegularPolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.geometry.RegularPolygon

  • public class RegularPolygon
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a regular polygon. Defines a regular polygon with three or more sides of a given length, and with one of the orientations defined by PolygonOrientation. The vertex coordinates of all polygons are symmetrical across the vertical axis, and those of polygons with an even number of sides are also symmetrical across the horizontal axis.

    Upon construction, RegularPolygon calculates the radii of the inscribed and circumscribed circles, the coordinates of all vertices, and the minimum bounding rectangle. All of these values are immutable once defined. Methods that seem to change the side length of a given RegularPolygon return a new instance instead.

    • Field Detail

      • bounds

        public final RectD bounds
        The bounding RectD circumscribed around the RegularPolygon. All coordinates are relative to the center of the RegularPolygon. The RectD is horizontally centered on the RegularPolygon, and also vertically centered for an even number of sides. Both RectD.min coordinates are always negative, and both RectD.max coordinates are always positive.

      • connectivity

        public final int connectivity
        The maximum number of neighbors for the RegularPolygon. Equals sides if #vertexNeighbors is false, else twice that number. Applies to regular grids of adjacent identical RegularPolygon instances, such as the ones represented by PolygonGrid.

      • hasTopIndex

        public final boolean hasTopIndex
        Indicates whether index zero within connectivity is topmost. true if index zero within the connectivity range corresponds to the topmost edge or vertex of the RegularPolygon; false if this index corresponds to the edge to the right of the topmost vertex.

        hasTopIndex is true if one of the following conditions holds:

        • vertexNeighbors is true
        • orientation is PolygonOrientation.ON_EDGE, and sides is even
        • orientation is PolygonOrientation.ON_VERTEX, and sides is odd

      • innerRadius

        public final double innerRadius
        The radius of the circle inscribed within the RegularPolygon. Always greater than zero and smaller than outerRadius.

      • length

        public final double length
        The length of each side of the RegularPolygon. Always greater than zero.

      • orientation

        public final PolygonOrientation orientation
        The orientation of the RegularPolygon. Never null.

      • outerRadius

        public final double outerRadius
        The radius of the circle circumscribed around the RegularPolygon. Always greater than zero and greater than innerRadius.

      • sides

        public final int sides
        The number of sides of the RegularPolygon. Always greater than or equal to three.

      • vertexNeighbors

        public final boolean vertexNeighbors
        Indicates whether RegularPolygon instances that share only a common vertex are considered neighbors. Applies to regular grids of adjacent identical RegularPolygon instances, such as the ones represented by PolygonGrid. Always false if sides exceeds four, as inner angle of more than 90° prevent adjacent instances from sharing a vertex without also sharing an edge.

        RegularPolygon instances that share a common edge are always considered neighbors. The maximum number of shared edges, and possibly vertices, equals sides. vertexNeighbors and sides together determine connectivity which in turn determines the index range used by angleToIndex(double) and indexToAngle(int).

      • vertices

        public final PointD[] vertices
        The PointD coordinates of all vertices of the RegularPolygon. Always contains sides elements. Starts with the topmost vertex or with the right-hand one of two topmost vertices, and continues clockwise.

        All coordinates are relative to the center of the RegularPolygon. The first element always has a negative PointD.y coordinate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RegularPolygon

        public RegularPolygon(double length,
                      int sides,
                      PolygonOrientation orientation)
        Creates a RegularPolygon with the specified side length, number of sides, and orientation. vertexNeighbors is set to false.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of each side of the RegularPolygon
        sides - the number of sides of the RegularPolygon
        orientation - the orientation of the RegularPolygon
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is equal to or less than zero, or sides is less than three, or orientation is unknown
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if orientation is null

      • RegularPolygon

        public RegularPolygon(double length,
                      int sides,
                      PolygonOrientation orientation,
                      boolean vertexNeighbors)
        Creates a RegularPolygon with the specified side length, number of sides, and orientation.
        Parameters:
        length - the length of each side of the RegularPolygon
        sides - the number of sides of the RegularPolygon
        orientation - the orientation of the RegularPolygon
        vertexNeighbors - true if RegularPolygon instances that share only a common vertex are considered neighbors, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is equal to or less than zero, or sides is less than three, or vertexNeighbors is true and sides is greater than four, or orientation is unknown
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if orientation is null

    • Method Detail

      • angleToIndex

        public int angleToIndex(double angle)
        Converts the specified central angle to the index of the corresponding edge or vertex. The specified angle is measured from the center of the RegularPolygon, and increases clockwise from the right-hand side of the x-axis.

        If vertexNeighbors is false, the returned index enumerates all edges in clockwise direction. Counting starts at the topmost edge if hasTopIndex is true, and with the edge to the right of the topmost vertex otherwise.

        If vertexNeighbors is true, the returned index enumerates all edges and vertices in an alternating sequence. Counting starts with the topmost edge if orientation equals PolygonOrientation.ON_EDGE and with the topmost vertex otherwise, continuing clockwise.

        Valid indices range from zero to connectivity less one. The 360 degrees of a full rotation around the central point are evenly divided among this range so that each index corresponds to an equal arc. If vertexNeighbors is true, the arcs that are mapped to edge indices cover only the central half of each edge. The arcs covering the outer parts are mapped to vertex indices instead.

        Parameters:
        angle - the central angle to convert, in degrees. Taken modulo 360° and may therefore lie outside the interval [0, 360)
        Returns:
        the zero-based index of the edge or vertex at angle

      • circumscribe

        public RegularPolygon circumscribe(double radius)
        Creates a similar RegularPolygon that is circumscribed around the specified circle. Returns the current instance if innerRadius already equals radius.
        Parameters:
        radius - the radius of the circle around which to circumscribe the RegularPolygon
        Returns:
        a RegularPolygon whose innerRadius equals radius and which is otherwise identical with the current instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if radius is equal to or less than zero

      • circumscribe

        public RegularPolygon circumscribe(double width,
                                   double height)
        Creates a similar RegularPolygon that is circumscribed around the specified rectangle. Returns exact results for triangles and squares only. For other polygons, the returned RegularPolygon is an approximation that includes some excess space around an inscribed rectangle with the specified width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the rectangle around which to circumscribe the RegularPolygon
        height - the width of the rectangle around which to circumscribe the RegularPolygon
        Returns:
        a RegularPolygon whose bounds completely cover both width and height, and which is otherwise identical with the current instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is equal to or less than zero

      • compassToIndex

        public int compassToIndex(Compass compass)
        Converts the specified Compass direction to the corresponding edge or vertex index. Returns the result of Compass.degrees() for compass, less 90 degrees. See angleToIndex(double) for an explanation of index values.
        Parameters:
        compass - the Compass direction to convert
        Returns:
        the zero-based index of the edge or vertex closest to compass
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if compass is null

      • indexToAngle

        public double indexToAngle(int index)
        Converts the specified edge or vertex index to the corresponding central angle. Always returns a value within [0, 360) which is measured from the center of the RegularPolygon and increases clockwise from the right-hand side of the x-axis. This value represents the angle from the central point to the indicated vertex, or to the middle of the indicated edge.

        If vertexNeighbors is false, the specified index enumerates all edges in clockwise direction. Counting starts at the topmost edge if hasTopIndex is true, and with the edge to the right of the topmost vertex otherwise.

        If vertexNeighbors is true, the specified index enumerates all edges and vertices in an alternating sequence. Counting starts with the topmost edge for PolygonOrientation.ON_EDGE orientation and with the topmost vertex otherwise, continuing clockwise.

        Parameters:
        index - the zero-based index of an edge or vertex. Taken modulo connectivity and may therefore be negative or greater than the maximum index
        Returns:
        the central angle, in degrees, of the edge or vertex with the specified index

      • indexToCompass

        public Compass indexToCompass(int index)
        Converts the specified edge or vertex index to the corresponding Compass direction. First adds 90° to the result of indexToAngle(int) for the specified index, and then returns the result of Angle.degreesToCompass(double) for that angle. See indexToAngle(int) for an explanation of index values.
        Parameters:
        index - the zero-based index of an edge or vertex. Taken modulo connectivity and may therefore be negative or greater than the maximum index
        Returns:
        the Compass direction closest to the edge or vertex with the specified index

      • inflate

        public RegularPolygon inflate(double delta)
        Creates a similar RegularPolygon that is inflated by the specified radius. Returns the current instance if delta equals zero. Otherwise, adds delta (which may be negative) to outerRadius. The new length changes by the same ratio as the new outerRadius.
        Parameters:
        delta - the amount by which to inflate the outerRadius of the RegularPolygon
        Returns:
        a RegularPolygon whose outerRadius is inflated by delta and which is otherwise identical with the current instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if delta is equal to or less than the negative value of outerRadius

      • inscribe

        public RegularPolygon inscribe(double radius)
        Creates a similar RegularPolygon that is inscribed in the specified circle. Returns the current instance if outerRadius already equals radius.
        Parameters:
        radius - the radius of the circle in which to inscribe the RegularPolygon
        Returns:
        a RegularPolygon whose outerRadius equals radius and which is otherwise identical with the current instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if radius is equal to or less than zero

      • inscribe

        public RegularPolygon inscribe(double width,
                               double height)
        Creates a similar RegularPolygon that is inscribed in the specified rectangle. Returns the current instance if the extensions of bounds already equal both width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the rectangle in which to inscribe the RegularPolygon
        height - the width of the rectangle in which to inscribe the RegularPolygon
        Returns:
        a RegularPolygon whose bounds exactly match either width or height without exceeding the other dimension, and which is otherwise identical with the current instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is equal to or less than zero

      • opposingIndex

        public int opposingIndex(int index)
        Determines the index of the edge or vertex opposite to that with the specified index. See indexToAngle(int) for an explanation of index values.
        Parameters:
        index - the zero-based index of an edge or vertex. Taken modulo connectivity and may therefore be negative or greater than the maximum index
        Returns:
        the zero-based index of the edge or vertex opposite index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if connectivity is odd, as opposing indices exist only if the total number of indices is even

      • resize

        public RegularPolygon resize(double length)
        Creates a similar RegularPolygon with the specified side length. Returns the current instance if length already equals the specified length.
        Parameters:
        length - the new length for the RegularPolygon
        Returns:
        a RegularPolygon whose length equals length and which is otherwise identical with the current instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is equal to or less than zero
